intro: Cuphea hookeriana f. typica, commonly known as the silver mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and clusters of tubular, pinkish-red flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a versatile addition to both landscapes and containers.
